Package org.openlca.core.matrix.format

Class CSCMatrix

java.lang.Object
org.openlca.core.matrix.format.CSCMatrix
All Implemented Interfaces:
MatrixReader, Copyable<MatrixReader>
public class CSCMatrix extends Object implements MatrixReader
Implements a compressed-column representation of a sparse matrix (CSC = compressed sparse column). Note that this format is not editable. Calling `set(row, col, val)` will throw an exception.

  • Field Details

    • rows

      public final int rows
      The total number of rows.

    • columns

      public final int columns
      The total number of columns.

    • values

      public final double[] values
      The vector with non-zero entries $A.val$.

    • columnPointers

      public final int[] columnPointers
      The column pointers $A.c$ that indicate where each column begins. The last component of $A.c$ contains the number of non-zero entries $nz(A)$.

    • rowIndices

      public final int[] rowIndices
      The row indices $A.r$ of the non-zero entries $A.val$.

  • Method Details

    • isSparse

      public final boolean isSparse()
      Description copied from interface: MatrixReader
      Returns true if the type of this implementation is a sparse matrix structure. It does **not** look into this matrix and checks if it is filled sparsely but just returns true if the storage type is optimized for sparsity.
      Specified by:
      isSparse in interface MatrixReader

    • iterate

      public void iterate​(EntryFunction fn)
      Description copied from interface: MatrixReader
      Iterates over the non-zero values in this matrix. There is no defined order in which the matrix entries are processed. Specifically sparse matrix layouts should overwrite this function with faster implementations.
      Specified by:
      iterate in interface MatrixReader

    • scaleColumns

      public void scaleColumns​(double[] v)
      Note that this method changes the data of this matrix in place. This is a fast operation of CSC matrices.
